subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] BPJ's roposal for QS-SAMPA ligatures and half-letters
msgSnippet: ... I mostly have trouble with half-letters at the bottom {w d z}, more seldom with those at the top. I do have problem with {wI} for with which I keep
messageBody:
On 2007-12-10 Moira O'Brien wrote:
> I guess it is experience of reading handwritten script with these half
> letters that is the problem. It is less of a problem with typed
> script
> which is clearer and consistent, but I still prefer not to use them.
>
> Moira
>

I mostly have trouble with half-letters at the bottom {w d
z}, more seldom with those at the top. I do have problem
with {wI} for "with" which I keep wanting to read as {Mi}
"we(e)" for some reason, while having trouble with {w}
for "we". This is probably because the shorthand system I
use (my own adaptation of Melin's Swedish shorthand for
English) uses _w_ for "was" and writes out "we". It
does abreviate "with" to _wI_, but it's a whole other set
of symbols of course!


/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
"Sometimes you can't make it
The best you can do is to fake it" (U2)
